metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12657 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.6.5. There is ause-after-free in block/bfq-iosched.c related to bfq_idle_slice_timer_body.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12657` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-31-generic - 5.4.0-31.35
linux-image-5.4.0-31-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-31.35
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-31-generic - 5.4.0-31.35
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-31-lowlatency - 5.4.0-31.35
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1011-kvm - 5.4.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1011-aws - 5.4.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1012-azure - 5.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1011-gcp - 5.4.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1011-oracle - 5.4.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1010-oem - 5.6.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1011-raspi - 5.4.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic-64k - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-lowlatency - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.10.0-1008-oem - 5.10.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1008-gkeop - 5.4.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-31.35').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1011.11').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1011.11').
linux-azure package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1012.12').
linux-gcp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1011.11').
linux-oracle package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1011.11').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1010.10').
linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1011.11').
linux-hwe-5.8 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1').
linux-oem-5.10 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.10.0-1008.9').
linux-gkeop package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1008.9').
